Referred sequentially to the House Committee on Natural Resources for a period ending not later than April 29, 1994 for consideration of such provisions of the bill and amendment as fall within the jursidiction of the committee pursuant to clause 1(n), rule X.
Late Referral to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands (Apr 27, 94).
Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands Prior to Referral.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held and Forwarded to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote Prior to Referral by the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
House Committee on Natural Resources Granted an extension for further consideration ending not later than May 6, 1994.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-453, Part II. Filed late, pursuant to previous special order.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 275.
Mr. Mineta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 492.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Traficant moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 103-279.

official_title: To amend the John F. Kennedy Center Act to transfer operating responsibilities to the Board of Trustees of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, and for other purposes.
short_title: John F. Kennedy Center Act Amendments of 1994

summary.text: John F. Kennedy Center Act Amendments of 1994 - Amends the John F. Kennedy Center Act to transfer operating responsibilities for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts from the Secretary of the Interior to the Center's Board of Trustees. Revises provisions for Board membership, duties, powers, officers and employees, reviews, audits, and claims. Sets forth collective bargaining requirements with respect to theatrical employees. Authorizes appropriations.
